intro: Galanthus rizehensis, commonly known as the Rize snowdrop, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its early spring blooms, typically appearing in February or March. The plant features white, nodding flowers with a greenish-yellow spathe, and its leaves are narrow and grass-like. It thrives in woodland areas and shaded gardens, preferring moist, well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
